title: Fix,refactor(all-pages): `date-string` fn
body:
Originally written by @estellerostan in #169 

# Problem

Output of `date-string` is sometimes incorrect.

```
(date-string 1593878525897)
; => "July 07, 2020 12:2pm"
```

# To Reproduce

Open Athens with `ego` db. Take a look at some of the values.

![Screen Shot 2020-07-04 at 12 31 30 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8952138/86516868-4bd1d700-bdf2-11ea-85c9-8b155aa86e98.png)

**Steps**

- Idiomatically:
  - create a separate `def` for the `date-col-format`
  - refactor the current function to use `as->` thread macro
- Practically:
  - How is the `(< ts 1)` supposed to work? `ts` can either by a timestamp integer or `nil`, if I'm not mistaken. I'm not sure this is the best predicate.

```
(def date-col-format (t/formatter "LLLL MM, yyyy h':'ma"))

(defn date-string
  [ts]
  (if (< ts 1)
    [:span "(unknown date)"]
    (as-> (js/Date. ts) x
      (t/instant x)
      (t/date-time x)
      (t/format date-col-format x)
      (str/replace x #"AM" "am")
      (str/replace x #"PM" "pm"))))
```
